definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
(of a woman) to be fiercely protective of one's children
see 王八羔子[wang2 ba1 gao1 zi5]

sentences.english: There you will have the option to edit or delete them.
sentences.chinese: 要不就編輯要不就刪除，開始扯犢子吧。

sentences.english: Watch your mouth. Do you know who you"re talking to?"
sentences.chinese: 瞎了你的狗眼，知道你在跟誰裝犢子嗎？

definition: to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
lit. one palm alone cannot clap (proverb)/fig. it takes two persons to start a dispute/it takes two to tango/it's difficult to achieve anything without support
pinyin: yi1 ge5 ba1 zhang3 pai1 bu4 xiang3

definition: to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
